channel.title: Leech and Anti-Leech?
channel.description:
Can someone just give me a brief explanation on the two? Never really understood then (:
- xHOLYx

item.title: Leech and Anti-Leech?
item.dc:creator: @Enoclious Enoclious
item.description:
@Enoclious wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:7, topic:369376”][quote author=Enoclious link=topic=465511.msg3404123#msg3404123 date=1290201604]

An “anti-leech” is some kind of precaution against this, such as modifying the functionality or validity of a piece of code.

So if I took the following code:

public static void printBacon() {
    System.out.println("Bacon!");
}

and changed it to:

private void printBacon(Type type) {
    system.err.print(Bacon!)
}

that is an example of anti-leech?

[font=times new roman]I suppose.[/font]
[/quote]but then the code doesn’t do what it’s supposed to do, so why even release it?[/quote]
[font=times new roman]A more contextual anti-leech would be for example a complete server being released without walking capabilities. It is believed that the average “leecher” would not be capable of fixing it and therefore not be able to utilize the server. A major flaw in most modern anti-leeches is that there’s always that person whom releases a fix.[/font]

[quote=“ollie123, post:8, topic:369376”]Anyone with half a brain cell could remove an anti-leech.[/quote][font=times new roman]People don’t make them difficult enough.
[/font]

Read full topic

item.title: Leech and Anti-Leech?
item.dc:creator: @Enoclious Enoclious
item.description:
@Enoclious wrote:

[quote=“xHOLYx, post:5, topic:369376”]I think I understand, leeching is taking someone’s work and claiming it as your own, like plagiarizing, and and anti-leech, would be like putting my name somewhere in the source I release like:

if (username.equalsIgnoreCase("holy")) {
 playerRighter == 3;
}

Thanks for the responce guys (:[/quote]
[font=times new roman]Not exactly.

Edit:
I should clarify, your definition of leeching is accurate but your example of an anti-leech isn’t as much.
[/font]

Read full topic

item.title: Leech and Anti-Leech?
item.dc:creator: @Enoclious Enoclious
item.description:
@Enoclious wrote:

[font=times new roman]“Leeching” in it’s most basic form is where someone takes something made by someone else, changes very little or nothing at all and calls it their own. An “anti-leech” is some kind of precaution against this, such as modifying the functionality or validity of a piece of code. I hope that makes sense. If not I’m sure you can find a definition online.[/font]

Read full topic
